name: baryonyx
text:
I repeat both lines from the final panel on a frequent basis. But even established Achewood readers invariably give me funny looks when I do so.

That's the part when I become disappointed in them.

name: dasuta
text: Every time I see Philippe begin to descend into "the fear,"  I cannot help but laugh until I bgin to cry.  It is beautiful.

name: redmange
text: Thou shalt hate the playa, regardless of his game.

name: pzukowski
text: Phillipe's guilt ballons are hilarious, because we all have them, but seldom admit it.

name: pzukowski
text: "Balloons" of course.

name: chachibenji
text: INCREDIBLE DEATH by ASTONISHING MALADY

name: possums
text: I used to have a roommate from Hong Kong. The "Yes ok uh huh ok yes bye" is a common Chinese thing.

name: fuzzyshoo
text: My favorite strip. :)

name: akadriver
text: This strip answers a question that nagged me all along... the pronunciation of Philippe's name.  I wasn't sure if it was all French "fee-leep" or Spanish "fee-lee-pay."  Unless Ultra Peanut is pronouncing it wrong... well, more wrong than just the r/l thing... now I know.

name: laserblade
text: Not to be an Internet pedant, but in Spanish it's spelled "Felipe" and pronounced "feh-lee-pay", so you didn't have to wonder.

name: akadriver
text: From one internet pedant to another, I thank you.

name: laserblade
text: Yeah see, where English and French have etymological spelling, where "ph" designates a Greek phi, Spanish has almost entirely phonetic spelling, so you'll only see Fs there.

name: gigs
text:
I still can't wrap my head around 'fee-leep'. It just sounds so wrong after hearing it as 'feh-lee-pay' for so long.

If there is ever an Achewood cartoon, my head will go crazy whenever Philippe appears.

name: mercuri0us
text: I love the way Phillipe always rushes everywhere.

name: radarjammer
text: Is Urrtra Peanut!
